summary:
Frans is a widely recognised expert and organiser in the field of political economy, globalisation, urban internationalism, and new political trends, with excellent analytical capacities. He has many years of experience at the edge of strategic policy analysis, politics and research; as journalist, writer, evaluator and advisor of politicians and policy makers. He was the founder and director of the international online think tank The Broker. He has a very broad international network of academics, policy makers, politicians, journalists, social movements, and non-governmental organisations. Frans conceptualised, founded and led The Broker since 2007. He built it on his previous work on policy coherence for development and his geopolitical and political-economic analyses. In the past year he worked as freelancer advisor, writer, and activist on urban internationalism and tax justice.  Currently he is strategic advisor at the municipality of Amsterdam on urban internationalism.

He is the author of books, analyses of international political-economic trends and academic and policy debates, many journalistic articles, background reports, and opinion articles. Frans has a good overview and grasp of major (urban) development, foreign policy, security, and globalisation topics and debates – in academic, policy, and political arenas. His strength lies in combining and ‘brokering’ different views and angles into a coherent and strategic vision. His background as a political scientist and international relations scholar has given him an ample measure of analytical rigour; his long-time observations of international policy and politics and his work with and advise to high level policy makers and politicians have provided him with the concrete hands-on knowledge.

profile_positions.description:
Executive and financial director of The Broker (www.thebrokeronline.eu). Responsible for an international online ‘thinknet’ about strategic affairs related to global and European (political) economy, international security, and global sustainable development. Producing leading dossiers on current issues in the global policy arena for The Broker website. Managing The Broker collaboration in three of the five knowledge platforms of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, about food security, security & the rule of law, and inclusive development. Publication of dozens of articles and editorials.

	Responsibilities: general management of all the content producing processes for the Broker website and the Broker contribution to the knowledge platforms; overview and analysis of all relevant international issues and academic and policy debates, through extensive networks and ‘communities’ of experts and policy makers; design of the editorial and financial strategy; general management of a team of 10-20 ‘knowledge brokers’ and supporters and of a network of freelance collaborators and experts in the Netherlands and abroad.
	The Broker is published by Foundation IDP, chair of the board was Monika Sie Dhian Ho, replaced in July 2016 by Jaap Dijkstra.

profile_positions.description:
Editor-in-Chief and cofounder at The (global development knowledge) Broker, independent international magazine and website on globalization and development, which brings together cutting-edge knowledge and expert opinions from researchers, policy makers and professionals. Funded by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, NWO-Wotro, Hivos, Cordaid, SNV, Oxfam Novib, NCDO, and ECDPM. 
	
	Responsibilities: directing as an Editor-in-Chief overall website and magazine production processes; devising editorial strategies and priorities; managing the 6-person editorial team and all its work processes for both print and website publications; overseeing international debates hosted at the website; coordinating and writing, together with publisher, long term strategic and funding plans for the publications; devise strategy and content for theme page on global development and write associated editor’s blog. 
	
The Broker is published by Foundation IDP, chair of the board was Louk de la Rive Box.
profile_positions.title: Editor in Chief
